value: caption=Rock formations in the La Ciénaga area near Cafayate

.
Cafayate is known for its vineyards as well as for its fantastic rock formations.
- 5 hours, 4 daily departures $106 with Aconquija (Feb 2012) **the route is sometimes closed during the rainy season

- Ride comfortably with air-conditioning and your own private English-speaking driver, with the option to stop at a variety of bodegas, quaint towns, and historic sites along the way. http://www.ponchotours.com/
Town may be explored on foot, there are several place which hire bicycles to explore the vicinity.
The vineyards (bodegas), the Quebrada de Cafayate.

Traditional empanadas, tamales and humitas are easy to find and delicious. 
Be sure to try ice cream made from local wines - Ruta Nac. 40 between C.Q de Nino and Cordoba has a few ice cream shops.
Accommodation is generally no problem in Cafayate, there are a multitude of cheap small hostels as well as more expensive and more luxurious hotels.

value: , centrally located, offering free breakfast, WIFI, internet, kitchen use, outdoor patio areas, dorms from Ar$50.00 (Feb 2012)
, hotel de charme located in the heart of town offers buffet breakfast, swimming pool, car parking, wireless Internet. The hotel receives guests from  all over the world. Gay friendly
